intro: Lasiacis standleyi, commonly known as the standley's lasiacis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
